isometricviewv2

Class Entity

  • java.lang.Object
    • isometricviewv2.Entity

  • public class Entity
extends java.lang.Object
    OVERVIEW: This class is responsible for either player-controlled or computer controlled characters within the game. Movement is the only real ability that a controllable character needs in a map editor, thus this class handles all movement.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Entity(int x, int y)
      REQUIRES: starting x-coordinate and y-coordinate.

      • Entity

        public Entity(int x,
              int y)
        REQUIRES: starting x-coordinate and y-coordinate. EFFECTS: initializes the player at that position.
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate
        y - y-coordinate

    • Method Detail

      • getFacingDirection

        public int getFacingDirection()
        EFFECTS: returns the character's heading. South is 0, west is 1, north is 2, east is 3.
        Returns:
        facing direction of the entity

      • setFacingDirection

        public void setFacingDirection(int direction)
        EFFECTS: changes the character's heading.
        Parameters:
        direction - the entity should be facing

      • getX

        public int getX()
        EFFECTS: returns the x-coordinate of the player.
        Returns:
        x-coordinate of entity

      • getY

        public int getY()
        EFFECTS: returns the y-coordinate of the player.
        Returns:
        y-coordinate of entity

      • getLastX

        public int getLastX()
        EFFECTS: returns the previous x-coordinate of the player.
        Returns:
        previous x-coordinate of entity

      • getLastY

        public int getLastY()
        EFFECTS: returns the previous y-coordinate of the player.
        Returns:
        previous y-coordinate of entity

      • setX

        public void setX(int location)
        REQUIRES: new x-coordinate for player. EFFECTS: changes the last x-coordinate to the current, and changes the current x-coordinate to the newly specified one,
        Parameters:
        location - new x-coordinate of the entity

      • setY

        public void setY(int location)
        REQUIRES: new y-coordinate for player. EFFECTS: changes the last y-coordinate to the current, and changes the current y-coordinate to the newly specified one,
        Parameters:
        location - new y-coordinate of the entity

      • moveEntity

        public void moveEntity(int direction,
                       Entity entity,
                       Map map)
        REQUIRES: a direction vector (out of 4 different possible values, south, west, north, east, in that order), an entity being moved and the map to be moving around in. EFFECTS: **IF** the player is able to move to the specified adjacent tile, then it will move the player there. Things that can stop you from moving to the tile include the edges of the map and clipped tiles MODIFIES: changes the value of the location array of the entity. May also change the height location of the entity if tile being moved to is at a different height level. May also change the map's offset values depending on if the player is too close to the edges of the on-screen grid.
        Parameters:
        direction - direction the entity is moving in
        entity - reference to the entity
        map - the map to be moving around in

      • decMovementCooldown

        public void decMovementCooldown()
        EFFECTS: decrements the movement cooldown, once per frame.

      • incMovementCooldown

        public void incMovementCooldown()
        EFFECTS: incurs an 8 frame cooldown on movement after every step. This number may be changed for different entities to control speed. MODIFIES: this.movementCooldown.

      • getMovementCooldown

        public int getMovementCooldown()
        EFFECTS: simply retrieves the current movement cooldown timer.
        Returns:
        movement cooldown for this entity

      • isMoving

        public boolean isMoving()
        EFFECTS: is a keyboard button being pressed? If so, this returns true (as currentlyMoving is set to true by the next function) otherwise returns false. Small note: this and the next function are used to avoid the keyboard delay when a key is first held down.
        Returns:
        true if moving, false if not moving

      • setMoving

        public void setMoving(boolean b)
        EFFECTS: starts movement, in any direction. Once this is set to true, the avatar moves by itself until the boolean is set to false.
        Parameters:
        b - true if moving, false if not moving
